alert.note: Alert for Craig; Nowata; Ottawa; Rogers; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 6:21PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Craig, northwestern Rogers, southwestern Ottawa, southern Washington and southern Nowata Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 620 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Ramona to 5 miles northeast of New Alluwe to 2 miles southwest of Bluejacket. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Vinita... Afton... Ramona... Bluejacket... Talala... New Alluwe... Watova... White Oak... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 288 and 300. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.
